lines:
August 30, 1910.

Dr. K. Y. Kwan,

Imperial Medical College,

Tion Sion, China.

My doar Dr. Kwan:

On my return to Andover from my vacation I find your lotter

of August 1st, inclosing draft for $500. which I am depositing to your boy's

account as requested.

I regret deeply that your intended visit to Andover has had to be

rearranged, but it is my earnest hope that we may yat have the pleasure of

899 ing and welcoming you in Andover.

Your most generous act in sending the silk referred to in your

letter is very deaply appreciated, I assure you, but I cannot help regretting

that you should feel under the slightest obligation to me in any way.

It is

a greater pleasure than I can tell you to be able to aid in the slightest

degree the Chinese boys who have been in tay charge, and no one individual

of that number has been a more satisfactory ward than has your boy.

With kindest personal regards, believe me, as always,

Very sincerely yours,

Principal.
raw: August 30, 1910. Dr. K. Y. Kwan, Imperial Medical College, Tion Sion, China. My doar Dr. Kwan: On my return to Andover from my vacation I find your lotter of August 1st, inclosing draft for $500. which I am depositing to your boy's account as requested. I regret deeply that your intended visit to Andover has had to be rearranged, but it is my earnest hope that we may yat have the pleasure of 899 ing and welcoming you in Andover. Your most generous act in sending the silk referred to in your letter is very deaply appreciated, I assure you, but I cannot help regretting that you should feel under the slightest obligation to me in any way. It is a greater pleasure than I can tell you to be able to aid in the slightest degree the Chinese boys who have been in tay charge, and no one individual of that number has been a more satisfactory ward than has your boy. With kindest personal regards, believe me, as always, Very sincerely yours, Principal.

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter stating that he is depositing the $500 check into the account. He regrets that Kwan will not visit Andover, and thanks Kwan for the generous silk gift and notes that it is his pleasure to work with the Chinese students.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
